message.content:
1. The study was conducted from 1997 to 2003.
2. The study involved patients aged 35 to 75 years.
3. The patients had been operated on for monolateral breast cancer more than 2 years prior to the study.
4. The patients did not receive adjuvant TAM after their operation.
5. The patients showed no signs of metastases at the time of the study.
6. The patients had no contraindication to TAM.
7. The patients were randomized to two groups.
8. One group was given TAM 20 mg/day orally for 2 years.
9. The other group was only followed up, without any additional treatment.
10. TAM was the drug used in the study.

messages.content:
Statement: From 1997 to 2003, patients aged 35 to 75 years, operated more than 2 years previously for monolateral breast cancer without adjuvant TAM, with no signs of metastases and no contraindication to TAM were randomized to TAM 20 mg/day orally for 2 years or follow-up alone.

List all the facts we explicitly know from the statement. Make each fact as atomic as possible.
